intro: Vangueria quarrei, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Vangueria quarrei is typically found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, thriving in arid to semi-arid environments.
